title: Create Calculator App

requirements.text: Implement a backend actor that exposes arithmetic functions: add, subtract, multiply, and divide. Division should return an error or null when dividing by zero.
acceptanceCriteria: add(a, b) returns the correct sum of two numbers
subtract(a, b) returns the correct difference
multiply(a, b) returns the correct product
divide(a, b) returns the correct quotient for non-zero b
divide(a, 0) returns an error or null result

requirements.text: Build a calculator UI with a numeric display, digit buttons (0–9), decimal point, operator buttons (+, −, ×, ÷), equals button, and a clear/reset button. Operations should call the backend actor functions.
acceptanceCriteria: Display shows current input and results
Digit buttons append digits to the current input
Operator buttons select the operation and store the first operand
Equals button triggers the backend call and shows the result
Clear button resets the display and internal state
Division by zero displays an appropriate error message on screen

requirements.text: Apply a clean, modern visual theme with a dark charcoal background, crisp white display text, and bold accent colors for operator keys. Use a minimal sans-serif typography and a card-style layout centered on the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Calculator is centered both vertically and horizontally on the page
Dark charcoal (#1e1e1e or similar) background is used
Operator buttons have a distinct accent color differing from digit buttons
Typography is clean and legible at all button sizes
Layout is consistent and visually cohesive

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo)
Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Scientific or advanced calculator functions (e.g., sqrt, sin, log)
User authentication or Internet Identity integration
Mobile app or native platform support
